crosswalk-realsense-webapi.title: Introducing Crosswalk Project Extensions for Intel® RealSense™ Technology
crosswalk-realsense-webapi.author: Web RealSense Team
crosswalk-realsense-webapi.desc: Time to develop RealSense applications with Web Technology.

crosswalk-realsense-webapi-zh.title: RealSense Web API介绍
crosswalk-realsense-webapi-zh.author: Web RealSenset团队
crosswalk-realsense-webapi-zh.desc: 是时候使用Web技术来开发RealSense应用了。

crosswalk-2015-summary.title: Crosswalk Project 2015: Highlights of a great year
crosswalk-2015-summary.author: Bob Spencer
crosswalk-2015-summary.desc: Crosswalk had an incredible 2015, growing in adoption, features, and integration. Here's raising a glass to all that was accomplished.

crosswalk-16.title: Crosswalk Project 16: Chromium 45, background_color, Widevine support
crosswalk-16.author: Crosswalk Team
crosswalk-16.desc: It is now possible to create 64-bit-optimized versions of Crosswalk applications.

android-64bit.title: Crosswalk for 64-bit Android Devices
android-64bit.author: Crosswalk Team
android-64bit.desc: It is now possible to create 64-bit-optimized versions of Crosswalk applications.

crosswalk-windows.title: Introducing Crosswalk Project For Windows
crosswalk-windows.author: Alexis Menard
crosswalk-windows.desc: Crosswalk makes its debut on Windows desktop. Windows 8.1 and Windows 10 currently working.

crosswalk-app-tools-07.title: Crosswalk App Tools, the fastest way to package Crosswalk Applications
crosswalk-app-tools-07.author: Robert Staudinger

crosswalk-game-mode.title: Crosswalk Game Mode
crosswalk-game-mode.author: Zhiqiang Yu
crosswalk-game-mode.desc: Working with Cocos2d, the game-development tool creators, Crosswalk engineers have identified effective web app performance optimizations that enable 5x improvement (near-native) for complex game scenarios.

announcing-web-testing-service.title: Announcing the Web Testing Service
announcing-web-testing-service.author: Belem Zhang
announcing-web-testing-service.desc: The new Web Testing Service is a collection of tests that demonstrate how well browsers or web runtimes support web standards on different platforms.  Now available for the Crosswalk Project.

crosswalk-15-beta.title: Crosswalk Project 15 Beta: Chromium 44, Android 4.0 support, migrating local storage from WebView, and more
crosswalk-15-beta.author: Francesco Balestrieri
crosswalk-15-beta.desc: Get the breakdown of the features in v15 Beta and other Crosswalk release updates.

using-custom-crosswalk-in-cordova-plugin.author: Francesco Balestrieri

copu2015-award.title: Crosswalk received 2015 Outstanding Open Source Project award
copu2015-award.author: Margaret LaBrecque

announce-linux-dt.title: Introducing Crosswalk Project for Debian Linux
announce-linux-dt.author: Xiang Long

ios-release.title: Introducing the Crosswalk Project for iOS
ios-release.author: Jonathan Dong

crosswalk-shared-mode.title: Using the Crosswalk Project Runtime in Shared Mode
crosswalk-shared-mode.author: Francesco Balestrieri

crosswalk-14-beta.title: Crosswalk Project 14 Beta: Shared Mode, Chromium 43, WebCL, SIMD for asm.js
crosswalk-14-beta.author: Francesco Balestrieri

crosswalk-app-tools-alpha.author: Robert Staudinger

crosswalk-12-beta.title: Crosswalk Project 12 Beta: Chromium 41, new SIMD.js and Embedding APIs
crosswalk-12-beta.author: Francesco Balestrieri

crosswalk-11-beta.title: Crosswalk 11 Beta: SIMD updates, Chromium 40, Service Worker
crosswalk-11-beta.author: Francesco Balestrieri

crosswalk-cordova-update-351.author: Francesco Balestrieri

Chromium Ozone-GBM explained.title: Chromium Ozone-GBM explained
Chromium Ozone-GBM explained.author: Tiago Vignatti
Chromium Ozone-GBM explained.desc: Discover the Ozone-GBM platform that gives support for hardware-accelerated graphics and input support in Linux, without relying on any traditional windowing system like X11, Wayland etc. In addition, learn how the Linux graphics and Chromium architecture function together.

Intel hosted Google engineers for coding.title: Intel hosted Google engineers for Text Improvements in Blink
Intel hosted Google engineers for coding.author: Dominik Röttsches
Intel hosted Google engineers for coding.desc: Intel's Open source Technology Center in Finland hosted Google engineers Emil A. Eklund and Behdad Esfahbod for a week of hacking on Blink's font subsystem. By switch Chrome on Mac over to HarfBuzz, we now have a unified shaper on all platforms, allowing us to optimize faster across platforms and a landslide of cleaning up legacy code.

chrome-apps-for-mobile.title: Chrome Apps for Mobile: Now with a faster dev workflow and a modern WebView
chrome-apps-for-mobile.author: Michal Mocny
chrome-apps-for-mobile.desc: …now you have a way to leverage the latest Chromium WebView on any device running Android versions back to Ice Cream Sandwich by bundling your Chrome App with an embeddable Chromium WebView, provided by the open source Crosswalk Project.

Application meta data for the web.title: Application meta data for the web
Application meta data for the web.author: Kenneth Christiansen
Application meta data for the web.desc: The Intel web team cares a lot about enabling real apps based on web technology. The web has had a huge impact on our industry and all of our lives, and we believe it would be sad if that impact and innovation doesn't become part of the new mobile world. This article discusses the the Manifest for web applications spec which aims at providing a single entry for web applications to store their meta data. Furthermore the current status is discusses as well as Intel's plans for the Crosswalk Project.

what-is-crosswalk.author: Greeshma Yellareddy
